description: Smallest number m such that m = i^2 mod prime(i) for 1<=i<=n.
example: 3rd term is 19 because this is the smallest number such that n = 1^2 mod 2, n = 2^2 mod 3 and n = 3^2 mod 5.
prog: (PARI) okm(m, n) = {for (i=1, n, pi = prime(i); if ((m % pi) != (i^2 % pi), return (0));); return (1);}a(n) = {m = 1; while (! okm(m, n), m++); m;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 02 2013
author: Joe K. Crump (joecr(AT)carolina.rr.com), Feb 16 2000
